definition:
&%AnabaticWind is a warm wind which blows
up a steep slop or mountain side, driven by heating of slope through insolation. It
typically occurs during the daytime in calm sunny weather. A hill or mountain 
top will be radiatively warmed by the Sun which in turn heats the air just above it. 
Air at a similar altitude over an adjacent valley or plain does not get warmed so 
much because of the greater distance to the ground below it.[Wikipedia]
